WARNING: DO NOT EXPORT YOUR COOKIES AND SEND THEM TO OTHERS
Email spammers ask for you to send them your cookies so that they can gain access to your account. With your cookies they have an active website session and can do anything with your web account that doesn't require a password (e.g. with your Facebook cookies they can post, write comments, create ads, without your permission). The export cookie feature is indispensable for downloading files via curl/wget from https domains.  I struggled for an hour to get wget to properly authenticate when trying to download a few dozen videos from o'reilly, but once I found this extension it took about a minute to get everything working perfectly.  Just make sure you go into the options and set the export format as netscape cookie file, paste the export into cookies.txt, pass that file to curl/wget, and you're golden!
